page.title: 12Leisure Activities
page.content: Many homes displayed a wide variety of leisure activities in which they took part in at home. Gardening was the major pastime however reading, knitting, sewing and walking also provedular activities. The residents felt that the development of leisure activities in the home were important due to the lack of facilities in the area. With regard to leisure activities outside the home, residents found themselves travelling outside the area to the nearby towns. There pursuits included model making, trade union activities, keep fit, air training corps and horse riding. The general lack of recreational facilities for the young is a major concern of the residents and some blame this for the recent increase in crimes such as car taking and house breaking.
